rogel.io.fopl.formulas.operators

Class OrOperator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.Formula
      • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.operators.AbstractOperator
        • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.operators.OrOperator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression

    public class OrOperator
extends AbstractOperator
    An OrOperator is an AbstractOperator Formula that computes the logical disjunction of its constituent Formulas as its value.
    Author:
    recardona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrOperator(Formula... operands)
      Constructs an OrOperator over the operand Formulas.

      AbstractOperator getOperatorTail()
      Constructs a new operator applied to this.operandCount() - 1 operands: the operands obtained by removing the operand Formula returned by this.getOperatorHead().

      Replaces any Variable in this Expression with its binding in the Substitution, if it exists.
      Expression standardizeVariablesApart(java.util.HashMap<Variable,Variable> newVariables)
      Replaces the Variables in this Expression with new copies of the Variable that have the same name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrOperator

        public OrOperator(Formula... operands)
        Constructs an OrOperator over the operand Formulas. The value of this operator is the logical disjunction of all the operands.
        Parameters:
        operands - The operands of this operator.

    • Method Detail

        public AbstractOperator getOperatorTail()
        Description copied from class: AbstractOperator
        Constructs a new operator applied to this.operandCount() - 1 operands: the operands obtained by removing the operand Formula returned by this.getOperatorHead().
        Specified by:
        getOperatorTail in class AbstractOperator
        Returns:
        a new operator applied to the tail of this operator, or null if no tail can exist.

      • replaceVariables

        public Expression replaceVariables(Substitution substitution)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Replaces any Variable in this Expression with its binding in the Substitution, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The Substitution set of Variables created thus far.
        Returns:
        an Expression with substituted Variables.

      • standardizeVariablesApart

        public Expression standardizeVariablesApart(java.util.HashMap<Variable,Variable> newVariables)
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        Replaces the Variables in this Expression with new copies of the Variable that have the same name. The copies are the Variables that have been standardized.
        Parameters:
        newVariables - The set of Variables that have been copied thus far.
        Returns:
        an Expression with standardized Variables.
